intro: Carduus clavulatus, commonly known as the clustered thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its spiny leaves and purple to pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, wastelands, and along roadsides. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs and have a distinctive clustering pattern at the base. The plant is known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses in treating skin conditions and digestive issues.
